name: Sea Ranch Resort

reviews.text: We planned a last minute trip to the outer banks and called all the hotels with indoor pools, and the Sea Ranch had the best price for the best room. We got a suite with 2 bedrooms ( king bed and 2 twins), 2 full bathrooms, ocean view with a long sunroom, full kitchen, and laundry room. We couldn't believe our luck considering what we got for the money compared to the other hotels we called. Other hotels wanted more money for a room with 2 double beds and no view. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Awesome suite at a sweet price

reviews.text: My wife and I recently travelled to North Carolina with friends for week of beach side living and golf. We booked our vacation through OBX Golf and were rewarded with accommodation in a two bedroom condo at the Sea Ranch resort. Each couple had their own two bedroom unit which meant we had tons of space, although we could have co-existed if necessary in one unit. The apartments have recently been upgraded with new carpeting and comfortable living area furniture. The kitchen was well equipped with new appliances and plenty of dishes, glassware and cutlery. The master bedroom had a great king size bed with a full ensuite. Two flat screen TV's with extensive satellite coverage as well as a DVD player. Our units were on the fourth floor and had fully glassed-in balconies with screened windows. We opened the sliding doors from both the master bedroom and living area upon arrival and they stayed open for the rest of the week. We ate, read, slept and awoke to the sound of the surf crashing on the beach. Oh did I mention that the Sea Ranch is right on he beach? We spent many fabulous hours walking for miles long the beach, playing in the surf and watching seagulls, gannets and dolphins. Not too bad! The staff of the Sea Ranch are friendly and helpful and each guest is provided with a complementary membership to the YMCA in nearby Nags Head. Plenty of shopping nearby including two huge supermarkets, a Food Lion and a Harris Teeter. I realize that other reviewers have been less than kind but they were either in an older unit or are extremely difficult to please. Both our friends and ourselves are picky travellers and we would return in a heart beat.
reviews.title: Great stay by the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to stay at Sea Ranch for a second time, but wanted to get an ocean front room. What we got was a suite that was better than we expected. The suite had a master bedroom, a second room with two twin beds, a living/dining room with a kitchen, and the best part, a enclosed three-season room overlooking the beach. Everything was in neat and orderly. Since it was a suite, we didn't have to fight for time in a bathroom since there were two. With the screen windows opened, the sounds from the beach were relaxing, especially at bed time. The one minor problem was the shower in our bedroom was only warm, when the other sinks and shower had good hot water. Also, if you know you know you will be staying in a suite, you may want to do some grocery shopping ahead of time. To us, it wasn't inconvenient to run up to the grocery store. We want to come back with the family.
reviews.title: Better Than We Expected

reviews.text: Got a great deal on this hotel in the Outer Banks. Kinda wish we would have spent a little more to stay somewhere a bit nicer. The place was deserted, only saw one other guest the 4 days we were there (albeit it was the off season). The rooms are musty and dingy. They're clean, but the comforters look like they're 30 years old and need to be replaced. Sheets were nice, but mattress was hard as a rock. They boast about having a heated pool, even have it on their advertising sign by the road... It was NOT heated. It was a touch above freezing and we could only stand to stay in it for a few minutes because we were shivering from the cold. Also there's no elevator, only stairs. So if that's a need for you or your family, don't stay here. It looks like there are renovations being started on the place, but it looks like they're mostly being done on the attached building which is all timeshare properties. When we called to make a reservation, they said no ocean front rooms were available. We asked that if when we got there if any were available could we pay the difference and upgrade, to which they said yes. When we got there and asked about this, they said they never have ocean front rooms available except for the large suites which are over $130/night. Trust and believe, I would never spend that much money to stay here. The $55/night we paid was pushing it. They give you breakfast vouchers for a free breakfast at a restaurant called the Jolly Roger which is about a block down the street. Loved it! Great breakfast and friendly service. That was the best part about the hotel. The staff at the hotel were incredibly friendly and hospitable though. However, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, nor would I stay there again myself.
reviews.title: Just a place to stay... Nothing special. Wouldn't stay here again.

reviews.text: First off the Sea Ranch does need some work, but they are in the process of doing this. A friend and I stayed this past December while on a hunting trip. The room was spacous for two people, and the beds seemed to sleep just fine. Checking in was a breeze, and so was checking out. The shower worked great, good channels on the tv. And we were able to get a room on the bottom floor next to the parking lot. Which worked out great for us, so we could unload our stuff and tote it right to our room. The beach area seemed nice even though we didn't use it. And it wasn't that far away from everything. So going somewhere to eat or shop was easy. I would stay there again, and will next year on another hunting trip.
reviews.title: My duck hunt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My spouse and I were invited to a wedding in Kill Devil Hills. The bride and groom reserved a block of rooms at the Sea Ranch, for guests, which is located on the beach. The front desk staff was friendly. When we checked in we learned that our rooms could be had for a cheaper rate than when we booked. We were given the lower rate for everyone in our party without argument. The room was spacious. It looked as though it had received some updating. It was very nice, but not fancy. It had a fridge, tv and "wet bar" area with writing desk and table. No safe. Housekeeping was fast and efficient. The oceanfront rooms have a glass enclosed balcony with slider windows, good for enjoying the view in nasty/cold weather. Be careful that you do not lock yourself out of the room when on the balcony since the only way to get help is to call from your cell or open the window and shout down to the beach. The Sea Ranch restaurant is The Pearl. It seemed popular with the "Saturday Night Crowd" and it was here that the wedding reception was held. The restaurant is surprisingly nice with a large meeting/banquet room across the hall from it. There is also outside "deck" dining. (We observed a "bachlorette party" being held there one afternoon, which appeared to be nicely done, i.e. chairs covered in white linen, etc.) The Pearl did an excellent job on food and beverage service and prep for the wedding reception. The staff was very pleasant and attentive. The Sea Ranch has a large indoor pool, kept very neat with lounge chairs. The bathrooms off the pool left something to be desired and need some work. At least one Trip Advisor reviewer mentioned "bugs" at the Sea Ranch. There were none in our room. I did spot one on a wall away from our room but otherwise saw no serious evidence of insect infestation. We thought this an excellent venue for a wedding. Another nearby restaurant is The Jolly Roger which has a great breakfast deal tied to the Sea Ranch. You receive a coupon from the Sea Ranch front desk for breakfast each morning and the food was more than ample and delicious. At night we stopped in there for a "nightcap" and walked home. Also nearby is the Outer Banks Brewing Station, but it is a short ride by car. The OBBS is a fun place to go with excellent food (not just burgers and fries, my dish was almost gourmet quality) and craft brewed beer. Shopping centers are located within walking distance of the Sea Ranch. On checkout the front desk urged us to return for another visit and, someday, we just might based on our stay.
reviews.title: Good Accommodations at Sea Ranch in Kill Devil Hills

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a disappointment. The outside was quite run down. Unfortunately, the room was quite dated and had a musty smell. One of the beds had a broken spring poking out of the mattress. Staff was friendly and helpful and told us they would definitely have maintenance check out the spring problem. The bedding was old and needed replacing. The balcony had a wonderful view, but we really were disappointed with our room. Free breakfast at Jolly Rogers was excellent. Quite a long wait, but well worth it. (even if we had paid)
reviews.title: not so great

reviews.text: We just returned from yet another GREAT stay at the Sea Ranch. We have been going there now for 5 years and the service just keeps getting better.
reviews.title: Another AWESOME stay at the Sea Ranch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff could not be any friendlier and actually they make you feel like family while you are staying there.
reviews.title: Beautiful view with a great breakfast at the Jolly Roger!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here Valentines Weekend 2010. We wanted to be on the beach, with a heated pool and breakfast included...We got 2 out of 3. The view was beautiful, so close to the ocean and the gorgeous sunrise was unbelievable. They included breakfast for 2 at the Jolly Roger for each morning and it was the best breakfast ever, absolutely delicious and very quaint. The heated pool was not so heated, it was not cold but not heated just kinda tepid. None the less we had a good weekend. The room was clean and no funky smells, nothing extravagant and definitely a bath only big enough for one person. I would recommend it,all in all a pretty good value.
reviews.title: Nice place, right on the beach!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a solid three star hotel. The rooms are clean enough and the amenties seem nice. We were down in March and the indoor pool was closed, but they were offering the Y as an alternative. The onsite restaurant was closed for the season. We had an oceanfront room and the view was great. The first night the neighbors were a little loud, but quieted down by the time we were ready to go to bed and we were able to sleep with our balcony door open to hear the surf. Check in was easy and the staff was courteous. Each morning we picked up a voucher that allowed us to get breakfast at Jolly Rogers. The choices were eggs and bacon or sausage, pancakes or waffles, or oatmeal. That experience is also easy. You just give them the voucher and you don't have to worry about checking out, which was busy in the off season so I imagine is very busy in season. I would stay at the Sea Ranch again for a quick getaway. I don't know if that is what I would want for a week vacation. I am used to renting a house for our week vacation.
reviews.title: A solid three star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i stayed for four nights. The staff was exceptional. We loved meeting them and they were very knowledgeable about the area. This was the fourth time i was at the beach but the first time i ever stayed at a hotel. The breakfast coupon at The Jolly Rodger was amazing. I would go back just to get breakfast there. We mainly enjoyed the beach but did go swimming in the indoor pool one night that it rained. We found the pool to be clean and well taken care of. The hotel does need some help with the outside appearance but don't let that fool you. Our room with a King bed was up to date and allowed for a peaceful night sleep. We really enjoyed ourselves and would stay at the Sea Ranch again.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed here after agreeing to see a timeshare presentation for another property. Therefore, we were given a very discounted rate on the room. Upon checking in we saw the real rates for the room and our jaws dropped. Seems the going rate for this place is $200 or more (summertime weekend).
reviews.title: Not Too Bad but Not Worth the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am sorry, but I would have been very upset to pay any more than $75 for this hotel. I have stayed in much nicer places for less. Here are some pros and cons:
reviews.title: Don't Bother

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Met our every need - great place to stay on the beach - would return!

reviews.text: The sea ranch is located on some beautiful beach front property. Meanwhile, my room was falling apart. The toliet was unstable. The shower was poor with exposed pipes and holes in the walls. The coffee maker did not work. On the up side, people were friendly and the bed was good. We paid $40/night which should be the most anyone pays, regardless of season for this relic.
reviews.title: sea ranch is not in good shape

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sea Ranch at the tail end of Hurricane Irene, and in a sense were lucky to find a room, as there didn't seem to be much availability in the Outerbanks. We only stayed for one night, as we just needed somewhere to crash before we were allowed to travel north thru Duck to get to our rental house.
reviews.title: The way beach hotels shouldn't be built

reviews.text: Anyway, we were nicely received at the front desk - no complaints there. However, the hotel is pretty dingy and run down - has definitely seen better days. I'm sure the immediate proximity to the beach and the humidity and sand and salt don't help - therein lies the problem - the hotel was built quite literally ON the beach. I mean, you can't get any closer to the water than this hotel. It's a 5 story concrete and glass bunker from which, if you could jump far enough, you would land in the surf. They must have built this place before sensible zoning laws were established/enforced.
reviews.title: Definitely Overpriced!

reviews.text: 2 other females and I (all of us between 25-30yrs old) stayed here for 2 nights on the wkd of our best friend's wedding. we were asked to stay due to our participation in the wedding, which was being held there on the beach and in the hotel's restaurant "The Pearl"
reviews.title: Will be seeing us again

reviews.text: I swore to the other 2 ladies that I would do a tripadvisor review on this hotel to forewarn any travelers who are looking for quality at the beach! DON'T stay here
reviews.title: we loved it & will be back!!!!!!

description: Enjoy the recently renovated room accommodations that reflect a coastal color palette and modern room finishes that will create a relaxing and comfortable space for your stay. Convenient on-site amenities include an enclosed heated pool, new fitness center and game room, outside picnic area and grill. The Sea Ranch also welcomes you to our oceanfront restaurant, the Beachside Bistro, which offers a delightful menu with a focus on American Coastal Cuisine. Join us for in the dining room or on our deck where you can soak in the beautiful ocean view! Beachfront Resort: All rooms in the beachfront resort and oceanside lodge offer: microwaves, refrigerators, Cable TV and Internet. Oceanfront Suites: We now offer 2 BR / 2 Bath fully equipped, condo style suites. Each suite offers a full kitchen, washer & dryer and living room with a sleeper sofa! Minimum of a 3 night stay required in season.
